item.title: Array
item.description: An array is a collection of elements stored in contiguous memory locations. Usage Algorithms Sorting Bubble sort Merge sort Insertion sort Bucket sort Quick sort Radix sort Heapsort Counting sort Complexity Table Max increasing sequence in an array Min and Max elements recursive non-recursive Find first pair of duplicates Additional memory Without additional memory Find common elements in 2 arrays Find a number in a sorted array Find a median in distributed collection on thousands of servers Maximum contigious subsequent sum problem

item.description: You heard about some cool website from your friends. You visit the website and try creating new account, but get a message, Username is already taken.

item.title: Introduction to Algorithms
item.description: Informally, an algorithm is any well-defined computational procedure that takes some value, or set of values, as input and produces some value, or set of values, as output.

item.title: Java 11 Fundamentals: Collections
item.description: Every application requires wide variety of data structures based on your use case. Implementing every basic data structures yourself is error prone, it’s hard to get everything right.

item.title: Kb(1024) or Kb(1000) Dilemma
item.description: Every engineer with computer science major stumbles on the question atleast once, weather to use 1000 bytes or 1024 bytes as 1 kilobyte equivalent.

item.title: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework : Conceptual Overview
item.description: The OAuth 2.0 Authorization framework enables a third-party application to obtain limited access to an HTTP service, either on behalf of a resource owner by orchestrating an approval interaction between the resource owner and the HTTP service, or by allowing the third-party application to obtain access on its own behalf.
